name: Virtual Volleyball
overview: Virtual Volleyball is an indoor volleyball game for one or two players based on official JVA (Japan Volleyball Association) rules. The game is presented in full 3D and viewed from a side-view perspective. There are three modes to choose from: World League mode is a single-player campaign mode to become world champion, Free Play lets the player set up a match between any two teams and any combination of human or computer players, and Tournament mode lets the player set up a tournament bracket for up to eight players. There are eight teams, each representing a different country, and with different strengths and weaknesses. There is also an information section detailing the official JVA rules, a glossary of volleyball terminology, and a manual for how the game is controlled.
